Description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ordered Mortgage Master, Inc. and Washington Federal to pay civil penalties for violating the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA), which requires certain mortgage lenders to accurately collect and report data about home mortgage loans. Mortgage Master will pay $425,000 and Washington Federal will pay $34,000 in civil penalties.
inaccurate reporting of Home Mortgage Disclosure Act data

Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
